page.title: 10MRS. SKIPPER - SCHOOL COOK
page.content: Mrs. Skipper has been the school cook at Weasenham for fifteen years. She gets up at 7.00a.m. and arrives at school at 7.45a.m. and then looks at the menu for the day. She selects the meat and makes up the powdered milk to use in the cooking. She makes lunch for 30 children at Weasenham and 20 at Whissonsett school. Twice a week she cooks 'meals on wheels' for elderly people in the area. The favourite lunches are roast dinners or fish fingers chips and beans and for sweet toffee tart iced buns or yoghurt.At 11.55a.m. she sets the tables in the larger classroom and then serves the dinners. Then she puts the dishes to soak and goes outside to look after the children at play. After she washes up she goes home at 1.45p.m. Apart from cooking, Mrs. Skipper's hobbies include knitting,sewing and gardening.
